name: Daniel Sean Lissner
title: Software Engineer/Developer
summary: Motivated, supportive, self-starting software engineer with experience throughout the stack emphasizing quality, best practices, and simplicity

work_history_attributes.title: Senior Software Engineer
highlights: Designed and developed hardware enabled SaaS platform for restaurant/bar operators to monitor bar activity, events, and inventory in real time via sensors and point-of-sale integration

Built RESTful API and GraphQL API microservices via Ruby on Rails with JWT authentication, role-based access control, per-client API keys, logging and metrics (via ELK), push-to-client data subscriptions, etc.
Developed inferencing engine to process streams of sensor readings, detect events, and update data models

Built front-end single-page app using React 16, Redux and Apollo GraphQL, featuring live-updating data visualizations, searchable reporting with PDF exporting, event notifications and alerts, administrative data management, user settings and preferences, etc.
Built 'Skeletor' terminal UI app via NodeJS/React/react-blessed to configure, test and debug hardware devices and view/log messages from serial port
Developed 'Hub' embedded NodeJS service to manage sensors, log and transmit readings, and enable remote configuration
Established and managed development processes, operations and technology choices, managed environments and infrastructure, oversaw contractors and internal developers
Defined product and features, established requirements, set deliverables and timelines, and communicated technology strategy, concerns and decisions to stakeholders

work_history_attributes.title: Software Engineer II
highlights: Developed ARGO  Message Broker to log, route, audit and replay 'HL7' healthcare messages across enterprise systems, with back-end consisting of  Apache Camel, Hibernate/Postgres, RabbitMQ, and Spring Boot REST API, and front-end SPA built with React/Redux and Material UI
Developed 'Propensity to Pay' loan/payment application with Groovy/Grails RESTful API and AngularJS/Material UI front-end
Developed reference implementations, component libraries and prototypes for AngularJS, React/Redux, Groovy/Grails, Ruby on Rails, NodeJS, Java/Spring, etc. and supported multiple teams and projects

Played key role in introduction of 'dev-ops' tools/practices such as integrated version control, issue tracker and build/test servers; 'one-click' deployments; and dev-prod parity/infrastructure as code via Ansible, Docker

work_history_attributes.title: Software Engineer
highlights: Collaboratively designed and developed 'Sherlock' to manage and visualize large sets of geospatial data, featuring interactive map with layer customization, complex data tables with searching and in-place editing, job management and monitoring, file uploading and management, and support for various workflows
Built Ruby on Rails REST API with Sequel ORM, Devise and Cancan for ActiveDirectory auth, Bunny RabbitMQ connector, Tire ElasticSearch client, etc.
Collaboratively built distributed architecture with Ruby/Sinatra and Python/Flask microservices for long-running background jobs, RabbitMQ for work queue
Oversaw product conceptualization, development, and launch of the company's first mobile product, CellMaps Mobile for Android
Developed 'BSid' service (Ruby/Sinatra back-end, Backbone front-end) to batch-process cell tower data and generate HTML reports

work_history_attributes.title: Associate Programmer/Analyst
highlights: Lead development of FedEx Mobile for Android and FedEx Windows 8
Assisted development of Fedex Mobile for Blackberry
Implemented fedex.com tracking interface (HTML/JavaScript/jQuery)
Worked with QA to develop testing strategy and automated testing pipeline for Android, using emulators, monkeyrunner, Device Anywhere
Assisted establishing mobile development strategies and evaluating technology & platform choices

work_history_attributes.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
highlights: Co-researched, developed and analysed algorithms and models for AutoTrack/AutoWitness, a system for tracking stolen assets via embedded inertial sensors, using Hidden Markov Models, Open Street Map road network topology, Kalman filtering, etc.
Implemented and tested software/hardware solutions using TinyOS/nesC for wireless sensor devices ('motes'), Java for PC 'base stations', and Android for mobile/smartphone base stations
Co-authored research paper published in ACM Sensys 2010

startup_experience_attributes.title: Co-founder/CTO
highlights: Designed and developed SaaS platform for managing mentoring programs featuring matching, messaging, custom on-boarding and application workflows, check-ins, reporting and exporting, SMS notifications
Traditional Rails monolith app with Devise, ActiveRecord, Formtastic, ActiveAdmin, paperclip, ERB templates,  RSpec, etc. with jQuery and Bootstrap for UI
Deployed on Heroku and integrated with multiple cloud services (MailChimp, AWS S3, Twilio, etc.)

community_efforts_attributes.description: Founding board-member of Memphis Technology Foundation
Organizer of Memphis Java User Group
Co-organizer of Security B-Sides Memphis information security conference
Multi-year volunteer & instructor for Black Girls Code
Multi-year participant and co-organizer of Hack Memphis
Multi-year participant of GiveCamp Memphis charity hackathon
Regular presenter at local developer meetups/user groups
